text:
The lockdown sucks all round, the kids are getting grouchy and ever more dependent on ipad and other screens - that aspect was better with reduced hours but obviously not sustainable workwise I guess.

Gardening with your mum sounds like a fun thing, any exercise is good - maybe something gamified or even some friendly competition in the household.

Its worth remembering that you don't have to be happy all the time. It's not depression if there's a legitimate reason to be down. Still keeping productive, healthy and not getting caught in mental feedback loops is important. Read any good books lately?
